text: This shopping mall has a legendary eatery. The auntie and the young guy, who I think is her son, were very nice. However, there‚Äôs an older uncle who seems to have taken all the stress of this mall and turned into someone even grumpier than the Grinch. The food is freshly cooked if you arrive early, around 10 AM to 11 AM, and the prices are very affordable. Keep up the good work, auntie and young man! As for the uncle, I hope a fairy godmother visits you someday so you can enjoy happier days on this earth. üôàüòÇüôèüèæüòúüëçüèæ

This assam curry fish head is very good and the  taste are excellent. I was looking for a new place to try, during my search on Google Web, coincidence saw this stall. I saw the tel no. and I just call to check the operation hour. The boss pick up the call so I told him I coming for the curry fish head. When I reach there surprisingly he ready cook the fish head for me. He even give me a free desert after I finish our meal. It is a small shop in a run down shopping centre, I won't aspects to find a nice assam fish head eatery here. I strongly recommend the fish head which cost $30.

Delicious Variety and Great Lunch Spot at Jia Yi Curry Fish Head Eatery

Jia Yi Curry Fish Head Eatery offers a fantastic array of Singaporean mixed vegetable rice dishes. Their selection is impressive, featuring fresh vegetables like kai lan, kang kong, and choi sim, along with flavorful meats such as lor bak (braised pork), curry chicken, and crispy fried chicken. Additionally, they serve delicious staples like fried rice and various types of fried noodles (egg noodles, bee hoon, kuey tiao).

The best time to visit is during lunch hours, as they keep their dishes available until 1:30 PM with plenty to choose from.

If you're not in the mood for mixed vegetable rice, they also offer a typical zi char menu, with dishes prepared on the spot. Options include hor fun and a variety of meat dishes with rice.

Don't forget to ask about the dessert soup of the day for a sweet finish to your meal.

Was running some errands around upper serangoon shopping centre and decided to settle my lunch over there. Chance upon this eatery on the 3rd level. Apparently, they sell economical rice. They also sell the standard zhichar fare like hor fan and fried rice.

Decided to go with their horfun, which was SGD$4.50. The horfan comes with the usual ingredient of prawn and sliced fishcake and pork. They used the thinner horfan instead. I believed the horfan was freshly fried but lack the wokhei .Portion was quite small, and may not be filling.

Overall, average plate of horfan for me.
Old school . Never disappoint . Hope they stay open
